page.title: 13TRANSPORT-ROGERSTONE AREA
page.content: There are 3 main Â£A'roads-the A468,A467 and the A4072.Bus services along these roads are limited to one bus every half hour,all coming from Newport and destined for the Rhymney,Sirhowy and Ebbw valleys.A new by-pass has reduced traffic conjestion in Rogerstone. Passenger railways were closed many years ago and the remaining line carries industrial cargoes like gravel and coal from nearby quarries and mines through the area.The Monmouthshire Canal's Western Arm passed through the north of the area carrying coal and pig iron to the Newport docks.Fourteen Locks is a popular recreational area today. The car has become indispensible to modern living.Of 175 questionnaire replies,158 families owned a car,82 owning 2 or more cars.
